title: latin/central american type foundries
content:
Hi all; I have a client in Panama and am interested in potentially using some more localized typefaces. The projects are real estate based.

I’m looking for suggestions for nice type foundries from specifically Panama, but also Central America or Latin America in general.

Any help would be appreciated. Many thanks.

 [‹ Color Correctness](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37087 "Go to previous forum topic") [1950s text face ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37107 "Go to next forum topic")
author: remy

comments.content: I recommend you get in contact with [Gabriel Martínez Meave](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Gabriel%252BMartinez%252BMeave) and [Leonardo Vázquez](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Leonardo%252BV%2525C3%2525A1zquez) who just presented a blindingly diverse display of [Mexican made typefaces at TypeCon2007](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/web.mac.com/gmmeave/Site/blog/Entries/2007/8/11_Forging_the_character_in_Seattle%3A_TypeCon_2007.html).

Luc Devroye has some pages devoted to the “type scenes” of various countries. Here are the ones he lists for Central and South America:

[Argentina](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/argentina.html)

[Brazil](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/brasilfonts.html)

[Chile](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/chile.html)

[Colombia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/colombia.html)

[Cuba](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/cuba.html)

[Mexico](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/mexico.html)

[Paraguay](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/paraguay.html)

[Uruguay](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/uruguay.html)

[Venezuela](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/venezuela.html)

Look at Alejandro LoCelso’s Pampa Type:

[http://pampatype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/pampatype.com/ "http://pampatype.com")

He’s Argentine, now based near Puebla, Mexico.

powers

He doesn’t have very many fonts, but here is one from Argentina:

[http://www.sudtipos.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/www.sudtipos.com/ "http://www.sudtipos.com")
this is hugely helpful, thanks. also i’m liking ds type although not central/south american.
Typokallos, Type-O-Tones is based in Spain, not Central or South America. :-)
[Emtype](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202194729/http:/www.emtype.net/), although based in Barcelona, is the work of Argentinean type designer, Eduardo Manso.
